Parking $10, Locker $5 --> |tuition = <!-- Yearly tuition--> |revenue = <!-- yearly revenue of school --> |communities = <!-- communities the school services --> |feeders = <!-- Feeder Schools for this school --> |main feeder school for = <!-- this school is a main feeder school for what other school--> |graduates = <!-- number of most recent graduates--> |year = <!-- most recent graduation year--> |affiliations = <!-- any school affiliations--> |alumni = <!-- any notable alumni --> |nobel_laureates = <!-- Any notable Nobel laureates from the school --> |website = [http://cherokeecounty.nc.schoolwebpages.com/education/school/school.php?sectiondetailid=505& School Website] |footnotes = <!-- footnotes --> |picture = <!-- picture of school --> |image_caption = <!-- caption for picture--> |picture2 = <!-- picture of school --> |image_caption2 = <!-- caption for picture --> }} '''Martins Creek Elementary/Middle School''' is an [[elementary school|elementary]] and [[middle school]], located in [[Murphy, North Carolina]], [[United States]], that serves approximately 265 students. The 61 acre campus includes playgrounds, hiking trails, mountain biking trails and a multi-functional gymnasium.
==Awards and distinctions== ===School=== Martins Creek has received many awards and distinctions including being in the top 25 Schools of Excellence in the North Carolina ABC program,<ref>[http://www.ncpublicschools.org/abc_results/results_99/99ABCsTop25.pdf North Carolina ABC top 25 Schools]</ref> a School of Distinction, a School of Exemplary Growth and was included in PC Magazine's Top 100 Wired Schools in the nation.{{Failed verification|date=May 2011}} It is also one of the few schools in the state to be recognized as achieving exemplary growth every year since the ABCs Program began.{{Failed verification|date=May 2011}}<ref>[http://cherokeecounty.nc.schoolwebpages.com/education/school/school.php?sectiondetailid=505& Martins Creek Elementary Middle School Official Website]</ref><ref>[http://www.psk12.com/rating/USindivphp/SchID_300383.html Martins Creek Elementary Middle on psk12.com]</ref><ref>[http://www.greatschools.org/search/search.page?state=NC&q=Martins+Creek&type=school Martins Creek Elementary Middle on Greatschools]</ref>
===Faculty=== Principal Arnold Mathews was named the ''2011 Wachovia Principal of the Year'' for [[Cherokee County, North Carolina|Cherokee County]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cherokeescout.com/articles/2010/10/26/community/doc4cc72d5bdba59594336056.txt |title=Mathews named principal of year |author=Lizz Harold |publisher=[[Cherokee Scout]] |date=October 26, 2010 |accessdate=May 15, 2011}}</ref>
==Demographics== Martins Creek educates in grades Pre-K through 8th grade. The 2011 enrollment of 265 is up from 202 in 2008-09, with a even gender split. The school has a student/teacher ratio of 9.9. The school population is 95% [[White American|white]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nces.ed.gov/ccd/schoolsearch/school_detail.asp?Search=1&InstName=martins+creek&State=37&SchoolType=1&SchoolType=2&SchoolType=3&SchoolType=4&SpecificSchlTypes=all&IncGrade=-1&LoGrade=-1&HiGrade=-1&ID=370078000321 |title=Search for Public Schools: Martins Creek Elementary/mid |publisher=[[National Center for Education Statistics]] |date=2008-09 |accessdate=May 15, 2011}}</ref>
==Solar power array== The school acquired the largest public school [[solar power]] array in North Carolina. The array produces around one megawatt of power. At the request of [[Heath Shuler]], the school was honored, for this initiative, in the [[United States House of Representatives]] on May 11, 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://shuler.house.gov/media/05112010_martins_creek_school.pdf |title=HONORING THE SOLAR POWER INITIATIVE AT MARTINS CREEK SCHOOL IN MURPHY, NC. |publisher=[[Congressional Record]] |date=May 11, 2010 |accessdate=May 15, 2011}}</ref> This project was funded by a $5 million donation from Nantahala Bank and Trust.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://wdef.com/solar_array_at_martins_creek_school |title=Solar Array At Martins Creek School |publisher=[[WDEF-TV]] |accessdate=May 15, 2011}}</ref> The plant was acquired by [[Duke Energy]] on April 11, 2011 on terms that benefit the school equivalent to the cost of staffing two full-time teachers. This is now the third largest such installation at a school in the US.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.enviro-news.com/news-releases/duke-energy-renewables-acquires-solar-farm-at-n-c--elementary-school.html |title=Duke Energy Renewables Acquires Solar Farm at N.C. Elementary School |publisher=Enviro News & Business |date=April 12, 2011 |accessdate=May 15, 2011}}</ref>
